docs.abstract: The president has repeatedly shifted his stance on a wide range of gun issues — from purchasing age to background checks to ownership rights — over nearly 20 years.
docs.snippet: The president has repeatedly shifted his stance on a wide range of gun issues — from purchasing age to background checks to ownership rights — over nearly 20 years.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump said on Monday that his administration would leave it to states to set an age limit for buying assault rifles. It was a reversal of weeks of repeated promises to act, and the latest of years of conflicting positions he has taken on a range of gun issues, from background checks to arming teachers.

headline.main: Trump’s Evolving Positions on Gun Issues
headline.print_headline: How Trump’s Positions  Evolved on Gun Issues From 1999 to Now

byline.original: By Linda Qiu and Kitty Bennett

docs.abstract: President Trump said on Tuesday that Canadians were smuggling shoes across the border “because the tariffs are so massive.” But under Nafta, Canada does not charge a tariff on American shoe imports.
docs.snippet: President Trump said on Tuesday that Canadians were smuggling shoes across the border “because the tariffs are so massive.” But under Nafta, Canada does not charge a tariff on American shoe imports.
docs.lead_paragraph: — President Trump,  speaking on Tuesday to the National Federation of Independent Business.

headline.main: Explaining Trump’s Claim About Canadians Smuggling Shoes Because of ‘Massive’ Tariffs

docs.abstract: Appearing for the first time before a congressional committee, the Facebook founder is likely to be asked about privacy, Russian meddling, fake news and more.
docs.snippet: Appearing for the first time before a congressional committee, the Facebook founder is likely to be asked about privacy, Russian meddling, fake news and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Mark Zuckerberg appears Tuesday afternoon before members of two Senate committees, it will be the culmination of a Facebook public relations blitz in the face of a series of controversies that have tarnished the reputation of the world’s largest social network.

headline.main: What Mark Zuckerberg Will Be Grilled On at the Congressional Hearings
headline.print_headline: A Roll Call of the Questions Zuckerberg Is Likely to Face

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: The Pentagon said Beijing’s buildup on disputed islands in the South Island Seas is not consistent with the security exercise among allies this summer.
docs.snippet: The Pentagon said Beijing’s buildup on disputed islands in the South Island Seas is not consistent with the security exercise among allies this summer.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States has disinvited China from participating in a multinational naval exercise scheduled for this summer, further escalating tensions with Beijing that have spanned from trade to North Korea to the military.

headline.main: U.S. Disinvites China From Military Exercise Amid Rising Tensions
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Disinvites Beijing From Military Exercise

docs.abstract: Four service members were wounded after a skirmish on Monday in Nangarhar Province in eastern Afghanistan.
docs.snippet: Four service members were wounded after a skirmish on Monday in Nangarhar Province in eastern Afghanistan.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An American service member was killed and four others were wounded after a skirmish on Monday in Nangarhar Province in eastern Afghanistan, the Pentagon said.

headline.main: U.S. Service Member Is Killed in Afghan Province

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: The Trump administration is pushing Afghan commanders to surrender rural and sparsely populated areas of the country and focus on protecting cities.
docs.snippet: The Trump administration is pushing Afghan commanders to surrender rural and sparsely populated areas of the country and focus on protecting cities.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration is urging American-backed Afghan troops to retreat from sparsely populated areas of the country, officials said, all but ensuring the Taliban will remain in control of vast stretches of the country.

headline.main: Newest U.S. Strategy in Afghanistan Mirrors Past Plans for Retreat
headline.print_headline: New U.S. Tactic In Afghanistan Urges Retreat

byline.original: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Helene Cooper

docs.abstract: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis demanded evidence of the Syrian government’s role in a suspected chemical attack to justify military action — and mute Russian criticism.
docs.snippet: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis demanded evidence of the Syrian government’s role in a suspected chemical attack to justify military action — and mute Russian criticism.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Defense Secretary Jim Mattis sought on Thursday to slow down an imminent strike on Syria, reflecting mounting concerns at the Pentagon that a concerted bombing campaign could escalate into a wider conflict between Russia, Iran and the West.

headline.main: Mattis Tries to Put Brakes on Possible Syria Strike, to ‘Keep This From Escalating’
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Urges Greater Caution For Syria Strike

docs.abstract: The State Department said the planes came within five feet of each other in “the latest example of Russian military activities disregarding international norms and agreements.”
docs.snippet: The State Department said the planes came within five feet of each other in “the latest example of Russian military activities disregarding international norms and agreements.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A Russian fighter jet buzzed an American spy plane over the Black Sea on Monday, United States officials said, in what the State Department characterized as an “unsafe” flyby.

headline.main: Russian Jet Buzzed American Spy Plane Over Black Sea, U.S. Says

docs.abstract: An investigation of the Oct. 4 deaths of four American soldiers describes misleading plans and lax oversight for a mission that ended in a firefight with extremists.
docs.snippet: An investigation of the Oct. 4 deaths of four American soldiers describes misleading plans and lax oversight for a mission that ended in a firefight with extremists.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A Defense Department investigation of a Special Forces mission in Niger last fall found widespread problems across all levels of the military counterterrorism operation, but focused in particular on the actions of junior officers leading up to an ambush that killed four American soldiers.

headline.main: Military Inquiry Finds Soldiers Were Unprepared in Deadly Niger Ambush
headline.print_headline: In Niger Study, Junior Officers Are the Focus

docs.abstract: French and Nigerien security officials say the Islamic State branch has 40 to 60 core members, but it is often joined by sympathetic villagers.
docs.snippet: French and Nigerien security officials say the Islamic State branch has 40 to 60 core members, but it is often joined by sympathetic villagers.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States has identified at least three Islamic State leaders accused of planning and directing an ambush last October in Niger that killed four American soldiers, officials said, locking the American military in an additional and possibly lengthy campaign to hunt and kill members of a little-known extremist group in northwest Africa.

headline.main: U.S. Identifies 3 ISIS Militants Who Led Deadly Ambush in Niger
headline.print_headline: U.S. Identifies 3 Militants From Branch of ISIS Who Led an Ambush in Niger
